Excellent Chrome plug-in. For some reason Windows 10 disabled chrome command line --proxy-server option and force chrome to use system setting of Proxy. But if you need anything more advanced than a whole browser proxy (like different proxies per website) then look elsewhere.

currently switching proxy changes only chrome proxy change but system still using proxy ...
Can add post script to enable or disable, system proxy as well

like below script will execute:-

@ECHO OFF

REG ADD "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings" /v ProxyEnable /t REG_DWORD /d 1 /f

REG ADD "HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings" /v ProxyServer /t REG_SZ /d address:portNumber /f
Very useful and easy to setup.

Works as advertised however be advised that by default your DNS lookups will leak. 

To avoid this you must uncheck “Predict network actions to improve page load performance” in Chrome Settings>Advanced.

DNS lookups for anything other than HTTP/HTTPS will still leak.
